content: Payment of benefits for the month of recipient's death. The amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to old-age insurance benefits and wife's insurance benefits, such as removing certain clauses and redesignating subparagraphs. The amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to husband's and child's insurance benefits, including redesignating subparagraphs and removing specific clauses. The Social Security Act is amended to change widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including adjustments to the months covered before certain events occur. The Social Security Act is amended to change widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including adjustments to the months covered before certain events occur such as remarriage or death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust widow's and widower's insurance benefits based on events like remarriage or death. Changes include adjusting the months covered before such events occur. SEC. 2. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends the Social Security Act to terminate the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon the recipient's death. The monthly insurance benefit for an individual who dies will be calculated based on the days preceding their death in that month. This calculation applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Section 223 of the Act is amended to include a new subsection for Disability Insurance Benefits. "Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death" The amount of an individual's monthly benefit under this section paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals are amended under Section 228 of the Act. The last payment of benefits terminates upon the individual's death. The amount paid for the month of death is calculated based on a fraction of the monthly benefit, adjusted for the number of days in the month. This provision applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. The amendments made by this Act will apply to deaths occurring on or after the enactment date.
